content: HATE the new layout. Why move the menu and buttons to the bottom after having them on top for what, a decade? New layout is clunky, unintuitive, and doesn't work like the old one did. This seems like change just for change's sake vs a real attempt to improve the app. 9 times out of 10 you'll learn that's a pretty stupid reason to change something. Take the hint Amazon. Ditch the update. It's absolutely horrible.

Not a fan of constant changes. Different looks on ev2 device. The searching options are horrible. When I look for Philips iron I would like to see it first, not 6 or 7 down the line. When searching for a ¬£10 product I would actually like to see ¬£10 items and to sponsored post of various prices. The serach option is very bad. I use Google search instead to find what I need. It's quicker and much better.

Is anyone else having issues with this app? It will not let me switch to another credit card OR it will NOT let me choose free shipping. The screen gets lighter and it just keeps spinning like as if it's going to work, but it never does!! So, I have not been able to order anything from Amazon. I did Uninstall the app and then added it back, but still the same. So Aggravating!! üò°üò°

It's fine, more convenient than using a browser... however the font size/magnification is a mess. Instead of respecting the device font size and screen magnification settings, Amazon has its own fixed font minimum sizes. So if your device is set to large fonts, and the screen magnification is set to larger, then unlike every other app in existence, this one has massive fonts in some places, normal fonts in others, and it cuts off buttons in the app because they're not properly adaptive.

It's slow and laggy and it heats up my phone terribly (a LG G7 Thinq). Takes a good 3-4 seconds minimum to respond to any input. Freezes up often. Randomly jumps down to a popup or makes me accidentally click another link when I'm trying to just see the pictures of the product, or reviews. Somehow it's never crashed, but I haven't run the app long enough to see if it would. Think I'll stick to computer shopping, thanks.

Don't pay for prime if you're looking for fast shipping. Shipping used to be fast and efficient up until the last few months. The decline has been quick and steady. Almost everything marked "prime" takes 5+ days. Instead of the advertised 2 day shipping- Prime used to be amazing when I was looking for things in a pinch. Now it's literally useless. I mean I scrolled through 100+ items that match my search results and came up with nothing that had reasonable shipping for items marked as 'prime.'

Since last update I literally cannot use the app. When I open it, it says "UH-OH Something went wrong on our end". Nothing works, not even any of the buttons. It only keeps saying the above message. This happens over 4g as well as over WiFi connections. This has been going on for a good while now. Makes me wonder does Amazon actually know there is a huge number of its users that are unable to use their app? hard to imagine a billion dollar company not realising this.

App works quite well, and I find the service is VERY good. It seems like the selection has been getting a little thin lately. Will never replace shopping in-store. Still, a very easy and enjoyable online shopping experience. One pet peeve: I HATE the new icon! I get that brown resembles a plainly-wrapped parcel, but it's ugly and fails to catch my eye in the jumble of other icons. What was wrong with Amazon Blue? Oh, and stop making paid shipping the default when free has been earned!

Not a fan of the new update... The font is all extra large. I haven't figured out how to change it and it makes the app more difficult to navigate. The tab system is different, but not problematic. That is until the bottom menu options go away. When they disappear, you can't get back to the main page without hitting the back button a billion times through everything you've looked at while in the app.

Who ever decided it was a good idea to change the app layout into this convoluted mess is a complete idiot. Can't stand it, and as a result won't be purchasing as often from the site. Your loss, my bank accounts gain. Hey Amazon here's a tip... You should want to make it easier for your customers, not more difficult. The app was more than fine the way it was.

Ive used the Amazon app on my phone for many years, and its generally been great. This said a new version has come out in April 2021 and since then its awful. The general feel on you phone is that your using a desktop website view, where not everything fits on the screen and excessive scrolling and clicks are needed to find what you need. One of the main benefits of amazon is ease of buying what you need. Its likely to mean less casual browsing for me and consequently a lower overall spend.

This app had been nice to use for some time. But no longer, as all I see is a blank screen after going back from a product screen to the screen which shows all available products. I uninstalled/reinstalled the app and cleared the cache, but still get a blank screen. Only thing to do is go to the Amazon main page and start searching again. I originally gave this app 2 stars because it had problems with blank previous screens. That's been fixed.

I've used this app on my phone for many years without any issues. Now ever since the recent update, with the new logo, it continually crashes within 10-15 seconds after loading making it totally useless. I've uninstalled and reinstalled several times without any improvement. What was wrong with the previous version? Don't fix what wasn't broken. This latest version appears totally broken and needs a fix quickly.

Definitely not as user friendly after the update. I have constantly used Amazon for most of my shopping needs, especially with how easy the app was to navigate. Now I'll probably be switching where I do most of my online shopping. Bring back the side bar piece that has all of my settings, lists, just everything in one place instead of taking the bottom half of the screen up.

The NEW LAYOUT in this app just made my shopping experience more difficult and cumbersome. Is that what you want Amazon? ... for people to stop using this app? Well, it worked. I don't like the changes you just made to the user interface. Those four buttons at the bottom of the screen are too close to the Android controls for my phone and I keep tapping the wrong ones. The cart belongs in the top right corner like everyone else does it, not at the bottom. CHANGE IT BACK TO THE WAY IT WAS!

Edit: It just keeps getting worse-pages won't load,search box won't clear,and the worst, clicked Proceed to Checkout and APP went straight to Order Confirmed! Not cool. I've been using this APP for years and it's always been good. The new bottom site navigation is awkward and backwards - going down to "scroll-up", instead of "drop-down" from the top to continue down, doesn't make sense. Also, it's too close to device navigation, which are generally located at the bottom of most devices.

Not a fan of the new update for one. But especially, lately, the service quality has gone way down. I have had a few instances of packages not showing up at all. I left a review in one such instance. It wasn't rude just honest about my experience and Amazon wouldn't allow it. Disappointing. I should be supporting smaller businesses more anyway.

The company is easy to order through and quick to fix any issues that arise. However the update to the app is awful. Instead of one or two clicks to check on my orders it's nearly 12. I used to have a large map once the driver was within 10 stops. Now I have about 1/8th of an inch that they jam the entire city map onto making the feature useless. The last design was easy to use this is like they had a brain storming session to figure out how to make it as difficult and terrible as possible.

Definitely laggy. You think it's your phone, but I just bought a new one and this app STILL freezes and lags. I don't think its received an update for a long time, I wish they'd fix it because it's convenient otherwise. But it's frustrating when you want to zoom in on items or delete things from your list. And it takes forever for items to load. Amazon, update your app already!

What happened? I have never had a single issue with the Amazon app. Now for the last 3 weeks it cannot open without immediately crashing. Yes I cleared memory and cache as well as uninstalling restarting and reinstalling the app. Get it together Amazon. I spen way to much money to have any issues at all with your app. It has now been over a month and still no action regarding this app crashing. Still no fix for the constant crashing. It has now been 6 weeks.

Since the last big UI update, the app has become terrible. It's become terribly slow to navigate (just trying to go to my orders takes a lot longer than it used to). Trying to read reviews on items is a chore as well now, as every time I open a review with pictures, it shows either the text or the pictures, but when I expand the text it just disappears completely most of the time. All the animations are also very laggy.

Once again congratulations to the app developers that have ruined something that used to work. The new app update has ruined the interface and made it awkward, clunky and even easier to freeze. I used to love the Amazon app because it was seamless and offered an effortless transition between the pages. Now, impossible to find which links will take you where you want, constant freezing and of course, the inability to go back to your account screen after a search because the toolbar disappears.

Please change the app back to the old interface. This new version is laggy, and a pain in the butt to navigate. Why change something that works? Users do not want to learn the new interface. As someone who shops almost exclusively on amazon 10s of thousands of dollar$ a year... I will be finding an alternative until the app is fixed. Bad choice Amazon!

I like shopping with Amazon, but I do get tired of them messing with the interface all the time. A recent change I absolutely hate is the addition of an ad bar at the top of the app that reloads every single time I click on anything and I have to wait until the ad fully loads before I can even use the page. It's not as though every page doesn't already have a dozen featured product ads. Why do I need more ads for other products slowing down my use of the entire app? Whose idea was that?

Regular user of this app. I don't like that they've taken away the ability to search the marketplace for different price points from different sellers for the same product. The lowest price is shown but doesn't include P&P. The different price points also don't sync up when compared to access through a computer. Mainly using app for quick search and tracking my orders.

The app used to be great, working flawlessly. The latest update however has introduced a raft of bugs: the app freezes half the time on opening, the tracking map is now so tiny it's useless, some of the buttons just don't work. Not sure exactly why Amazon found it necessary to reinvent the wheel and fix something that wasn't broken, but I hope they fix this asap.

been using Amazon for years now... a few times I've had issues with an item they rectified the situation right away. The one time a little over a year ago, they didn't even acknowledge the situation, so I lost out not only on the item I was trying to purchase, but also the payment made to seller for said item. Several attempts were made to contact both seller and Amazon with no response.

Takes a while to load things. There are problems that I thought were just from my end, but they have continued past me getting a new phone and downloading the app. For example, random crashes, and not being able to add items to my lists (even after clicking on the "add to list" button a million times -- this persists on different phones, too). Also pictures of items not loading sometimes. Kind of annoying, with all the money Amazon has, these should be very easy fixes.

Was great until the recent "update." They reformatted the UI to have the options at the bottom of the screen. Checking the status of an order now takes two extra steps and has a rather significant lag to open the order status menu. Sure, it's a first world problem, but I don't understand why they change things that don't need to be changed.

What idiot thought it was a good idea to put the menu across the bottom of the app where the phone controls are??? Stupid move. I'll start using my laptop more now and avoiding the app. As a side note, the app crashes more now (freezes up when trying to go from different pages or scrolling). So that's just another reason to avoid using it. I wish developers would stop screwing with an app when it was fine before all this. Now it's just a hot mess.

HATE new update. Use this daily and new update put a bar across bottom of the screen with "helpful" icons which take up WAY too much of the screen. Also, apparently, removed the ability to change the view to the line item view so now all I get is big pictures. Spent 26 minutes, got six different people in customer service trying to get an answer on how to fix this - best they could come up with was to reinstall it which I did and it still has the same issues. Absolutely horrible!!!

The most recent update of the AMAZON MUSIC APP removed the ability to PURCHASE music!! It switches you to the SHOPPING APP, which doesn't show the artist/album/song you want, but other music instead, forcing you to search AGAIN for the artist/album/song. The results UNFORTUNATELY show you EVERYTHING in the store, not just in DIGITAL MUSIC!! SERIOUSLY AMAZON??? FIX THIS!! I WANT TO BUY MUSIC TO SUPPORT THE ARTIST!!

Was very good before the latest update... I used to buy a LOT, and now I just tossed it because it lags. I can't change options on a product page (like colors for example), I click the option and it doesn't switch making it impossible to buy the options I want ... I would need to do it with my computer everytime so I just gave up... Not a bad thing I'm saving money now! ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Your loss Amazon, I saw I'm not alone! You can do better

Keeps reactivating subscriptions. I used to have a subscription for these gloves and I would get them once every 2 months but I canceled the subscription. Notice that it kepted coming in the mail and I had to cancel it again 3 times. I'd even do it with other people assisting me and it would clearly say that it was CANCELLED! and it kept charging me. Otherwise it's a great app.

Please roll back the last update. Can't access departments to filter results or drag product into lists. And the search results only have 10 to15 per page before having to go to a new page, which makes it difficult to skip all the unrelated results that inevitably occur. Are you trying to fix something that was not broken? I will not be shopping with you until this is "fixed ", mainly because I find it terribly annoying. 1year later. I am done. Canceled prime, deleted app. I hope others do also.

A shopping app that won't let you shop! I really didn't like the latest update, but today, searching for a book ( both paper and Kindle, as I have done before) I put in the title and author and the results gave me just 4 totally unrelated books. I talked to cust svcs who suggested that I should be searching for Kindle books in another app (ignoring the paper book search I was also trying to do). I am extremely disappointed and will not be buying books from Amazon again as it won't let me!

Horrible. This update ruined a great app. It is now useless for casual shopping. I usually buy random things when I see them on sale, well now all those sales are gone. No more 'hey this green one is on sale, I'll get that, instead of looking for the teal one of another brand.' I don't have the time, nor the want, to click on every option for an item to see the price for each one. It is completely useless. Please go back to the old interface.

This last update has made the app look like a badly loaded geocities website from 1999, washed out with oversized and badly aligned text that suggest missing content. The current trend for inverting the layout seems to have caught up here so it's all upside down now. This all wasn't problematic before, it was functional and looked fine (if a little 'pastel-y') To be fair, it all still works fine...it just looks utterly horrendous now. It needs a dark mode at least because it just looks anaemic

Terrible since the last update. The interface now has fixed controls at the top and bottom of the screen instead of a menu that can be hidden when not in use, the app is has many glitches now and I have to exit and reopen just for it to refresh my orders and basket. I no longer get delivery notifications, so I have to hope the parcel is delivered on the intended day rather than having confirmation. The driver location now doesn't update until after the estimated delivery window closes.

It if ain't broke, don't fix it, an age old saying, one amazon apparently has never heard. The old app was garbage enough, but the new one takes even longer to get the the features I use. It's not like there's many alternatives, but it sure makes me less inclined to use it very often. If amazon wants to shake things up, at least add a setting to switch it back.

New update sucks. Amazon was fine before this update. Not only was I spending daily , I was so happy with Amazon prime. Being able to access on my mobile app. Now it keeps saying I need to enter my info then it says it's sending a notification and doesn't even connect. I'm not sure if you are hacking me or what. I'm done with Amazon for now. Send me an email when you go back to the old interface.

It's no longer great! No longer functional the way it should. If you browes your history and tap back to the list it puts you back to the beginning all the time! The easy to select drop down list is gone! And replaced with icons that make no sense! There's not a single thing works as it did before the update! It's very upsetting!

The redesign is awful. Pictures can't be viewed full screen in landscape without the search box and bottom 4 options covering up 60% of it, zoom doesn't work for some pics, it's even more finicky than it was before, and it's infuriating to navigate. 2 stars bc at least it doesn't look like a web app anymore. But come on, don't push stuff that's broken. Even the symbol that shows which picture you're on has a remnant of old code where it looks like there's a black speck on my screen but it's not.

New changes with the menu bar at the bottom are awful. Why change something just to change it? Functionality of the app hasn't improved one iota. Amazon, you're focusing on the wrong things to change. Concentrate on the app working correctly first, the look of it second...and put the dang menu bar back at the TOP of the freaking app where it belongs and where it doesn't interfere with phone buttons! Ugh!!!!

Just got a new Pixel and I didn't realize Amazon updated when I opened the app after transferring my data over from my old phone. The layout is different which makes it difficult to navigate especially if you were used to the previous layout. If the app was going to go into this direction with the layout the developers should've updated new changes to the layout little by little over time. It's a big change and a new app logo wasn't going to prepare anyone for this drastic change.

New update ruined the app! I try to search for items while signed into the app. When I click on an item, it seems I'm on an internet browser window than in the app. It asks me to sign in again! Then it takes me to a page to enable cookies on the browser, WHEN I'M ON THE APP! I cannot get passed this page. What's the point of having an app to avoid the browser if they are the same thing.

When you put all your eggs in one basket..... They have integrated fresh into Amazon shopping. It's confusing when you search and non - fresh items come up. We just want to add to our fresh basket. Some items which are groceries cannot be placed in the fresh shopping cart. Preferred the old Prime now, and Amazon shopping app. It's frustrating to use....

I rarely have issues and if I do? Amazon comes to my rescue every single time!! Thank You!! UPDATE: I too don't like new layout. It's hard enough for some of us senior citizens, but the new layout is just plain frustrating and has taken alot of the enjoyment i used to feel when browsing the Amazon halls and walls for something fun to purchase. Please put it back the way it was!!!!!

Re-edited my post. I like the transition of the new Amazon app with the profile and everything front and center/top. And the search bar on the bottom. That looks way more fluid and nice. The only thing I don't really like is that the icon of the brown makes the app look dirty. Beyond that, it works perfectly and haven't had any issues with it. It's very fluid

App keeps shutting down and restarting on my Android Samsung phone. Same thing with Amazon Music and Amazon Photos. I switched to YouTube Music because of this annoyance. Wish Google offered similar shopping and photo app's--I would have switched those also! I have emptied my memory cache and strage for the app, I have done numerous phone restarts, and I have uninstalled and reinstalled with no change. Amazon, this is ridiculous and u acceptable!!!

Great until they changed the icon. The app worked well until they thought it was aesthetically pleasing to put a brown turd on my home screen. I had to switch to Nova launcher to change it. Go back to the old icon Amazon. update: the new user interface is awful and replaced a perfectly good system. whoever is in charge of changing user interface lately needs to go on vacation, they've gone crazy under lockdown.

Terrible!! , Instead of upgrading and updating the app, it went far back from where it was. Is frustrating that the last 4 orders I made, were cancelled because the sellers never took the money once the order was made and , thinking that was paid, I used the money, and ended up paying again. I had to cancel for good the orders because is getting tiring and frustrated. Continue like that and you will be as bad as Rakuten and those useless apps. I gave the app 1 star because I can't give less.

This app was really good until this latest update. It's awful. What idiot thought a menu across the bottom was a good idea? Especially when there's STILL a menu at the top! Change purely for the sake of it, and it's terrible. Please revert to the previous layout. UPDATE: after a day of using, on top of the appalling layout, the app is now really slow and stuttery. Dreadful dreadful update.

Amazon has been a great way to get products that are super hard to get wjere I live. I only wish the fees would stay lower since the shipping times can be so long. Prime 2 day has came through in 2 days only a few times in the last couple of years. Order before you need it. Still a great source of hard to find items and worth the wait.

I enjoy that I can find so many specialty products. I find that some products from Amazon are more expensive than shopping from a store.So if its something you can get close by , definitely price check. Shipping has been an occasional issue.One of our deliveries went to a neighbor who brought it to us( 25 lb of dog food!) Getting subscription deliveries is fine, but I find that they can be overly frequent.( delivery earlier than expected)

I absolutely hate how the app will leave my search if I have to put my phone down for 5 minutes, when I've already been browsing for a few pages. I also hate that there is no way to set default settings for a search. I ALWAYS want to set it to prime shipping, and I have to do this manually every time. The search functionality is garbage, too. I get irrelevant results on the first page.

There's honestly no reason to pay for Prime to get faster shipping. I can't begin to tell you how many orders have been late, even before covid. There's no such thing as 2-day delivery when it's three days late. It's hardly ever on time, even when it's coming from a warehouse in the same city! I can't set my account on the app for Amazon Smile. I can on my phone but not the app on my tablet. Settings> no Amazon Smile option unless notifications are turned on.

The latest update to this app is awful. It shows my name and information, but if I want view orders or anything else it prompts me to log in. When I try to log in it tells me to enable cookies on my web browser. First of all, cookies are enabled. Second, what do my browser settings have to do with the functions of the separate Amazon shopping app? This is ridiculous and makes me not want to use the app at all. This update tried to "fix" something that wasn't broken. I want my working app back.

Over all great and adheres to my needs as I shop with it nearly everyday HOWEVER I find it very interesting yet very f***** up that when you try to change the payment method at checkout or select free shipping (that should already be selected by default if I qualify) it gives you a plethora of technical issues including a gray snowy screen, and freezing. But it has absolutely no issue with the PLACE ORDER button ü§î P.S. I updated today (4/3/21)

PLEASE!! Stop ‚úã moving your app's storage location from SD card back to internal storage. I'm having to undo/maintain weekly, what developers chose to ignore. üò™ Whether this happens randomly or otherwise is irrelevant & it happens regardless ‚Äì I'm out of storage!! üò§ Eventually, out of frustration, I'll need to uninstall apps, one-by-one and just be done. üòü Every app to flood my internal storage will receive this notice. üòë I do like Amazon, but... Please, fix so I can change my 2-‚≠ê rating.ü§û

new features suck. If you search a term specifically, say a tv show with a big fanbase, results will be filterable by media categories only, and the prime shipping filter button on top disappears. Whomever decided this change to the search criteria was brilliant needs to be demoted. You've eliminated easily searchable items on your mobile platform by limiting yourself. no better than walmart now. edit: now included is useless spelling auto correct. very specific items will now be lost to you

New app interface is horrible. I don't know who thought it was a good idea! It makes it miserable to use the app now. Unless they change it back to the classic layout, I'm forced to delete this awful new version! CHANGE IT BACK AMAZON! We pay you too much, to make our buying experience complicated!

I used to like and buy a lot using the app, but since the last update is nearly impossible to utilize it! It's slow and it keeps logging me out every minute!! It's quite annoying! I can't do anything, because every time the log in page appears again and again, doesn't matter how many times I do it, it keeps asking the information again. And the new logo is terrible!

Can't view my order history. I've been using Amazon since 2006 and according to the app, I've never purchased anything. Way to drop the ball, Amazon. Update(2/26/21: Performing a search on the app automatically assigns a product category to the results. This is a huge inconvenience AND I can't remove the category. üò§ Update(4/9/21): Category is still automatically assigned to my results AND now I can't find/search for a nearby Amazon Locker?! Please hire a new app development team.

Great app, easy to use. Always handy to buy last minute items and is immeasurably helpful for uni books!! One gripe I have; I signed up to Amazon Smile ages ago, and was chuffed when I saw it was usable in the app as well as browser. Just tried to activate it on a new phone and had a pop-up saying notifications have to be turned on to do this. Really? To be able to support a charity when using the app (regularly!) I HAVE to have bothersome notifications about sales etc?? Disappointing üòû

Shipping is nightmare! Prior to 2021 everything was great. Now? I have ordered 2 different times. Tracking is nonexistent. Doesnt even show where package is. One package is lost. I waited till refund was about to run out to see if maybe it would show. Nope! Now tried to order another item and now it says its delayed again. Won't say where its coming from or anything, just that Amazon is shipping.

Every change introduced in the latest update is a deterioration from its predecessor. Controls at bottom of page are less obvious and intuitive and require more button presses/selections to get where you want to go than they did before... and don't get me started on the introduction of giant font sizes when searching. I'd genuinely hoped this was some sort of April fools Day prank, alas I was wrong.

I don't know when, but probably since they changed the logo, but the app almost never loads the first time - just get a blank white screen. If I swipe it away and reload it works fine for a while but then a future launch fail in exactly the same way! After years of rock solid, how could they release such a shonky app and not pull it immediately tjere was a problem. It's been like this for weeks now...

Keeps setting my purchases to gifts. A recent update seems to have screwed up the app. Everything I purchase is automatically set as a gift, even though I have not set it. It shows the gift packaging option for every item and when I go in and deselect GIFT, it ignores it again. Now I have to finalise purchases on my pc. Well done Amazon.

This update is horrible. Crashing occasionally. Putting buttons on the bottom is ridiculous since many of us have our phone navigation that pops up down there. Try to hit "back" on my phone and kept hitting amazon's "home" button. After doing it a bunch I decided amazon wasnt worth the headache. Did you even test this app prior to launching it? Seems unlikely because someone certainly would have realized it was trash.

No option but to use this only app, isn't it? Loads slow, buggy, lame age old UI/UX. It's not an issue with the app itself but with the overall Amazon website. Shame that Amazon can't even develop a good website. The only distinct advantage Amazon has over others are the "reviews" and excellent customer service. But as I said, we are left with no option but to use this lame and painfully slow app.

I purchased a Samsung Tab S7 and after installing the app it's impossible to navigate! When viewing items in your search half the page won't even load! 4‚òÜ's and the "You might also like" sections won't load, the spinning icon just sits there! After trying to use the app a few times I returned here and saw a message at the top of the app description that says " This app may not be optimized for your device" . What the heck does that mean? Why no support Section Amazon???

Amazon, I just want to thank you! I have spent about a thousand dollars through your app in the last five months. It was almost an addiction. But now, thanks to your new UI, the app takes about a minute to load just the front page. Switching between your "tabs" not only loses any progress the front page has loaded, but switching back doesn't even force load the front page or refresh it. Also, you somehow forced the app to auto-update despite my lack of consent. Thanks for breaking my addiction!!

App update is a step backwards. As if moving the controls from top to bottom wasn't worse enough, getting rid of the pop up menu and placing in on a new screen with a large font type is ridiculous and just slows down the whole process. And to add insult to injury, a lot of the photos don't even show up anymore for products when you click on them. Bottom line, not everyone with a computer is a web designer and in hiring the cheapest well you get what you pay for.

The menu bar relocation update has made the app unstable and frequently errors out or does not load the expected page. There seems to be ad inbetween you clicking the cart or any of the other options with sujested items before you have to click a second time to get to the cart. In my case there is items in the cart but the app won't allow me to get to them it keeps reloading the same ad page with 25% off airborne

used to be great for customers but now there a ton of scam sellers on the platform and amazon makes you jump through hoops or literally only gives you the option to call USPS when a seller simply does not ship an item.. except they don't even give you a tracking number to reference. ebay is more reliable than amazon now in terms of buyer protection and guaranteed shipping

Just updated the app and ran into a bit of a bug. It logged me out and asked me to log back in and when I did it would send me a authorization code via text message to verify it's me. If you get this code sent to you via text, you will need to long press the URL and select open in web page in order to get authorization for the Amazon app to access your account. Hopefully this bug gets fixed soon.

The latest ui changes are very disappointing and weird, as I find it hard to believe anyone thought the changes were sensible or acceptable. The ux has severely deteriorated due to layout and the need to click extra buttons to go to pages, such as orders, when previously it was a simple one click. I'd hope the developers either revert to the previous design or mak significant changes to the current design.

I have used other apps and none compared to the features that Amazon has. They have the easiest returns. Amazon has fixed each problem I had with a return, shipping, or anything else with their customer service. I can get a real person when I call customer service. Not a lot of online companies do that. Also keep ordering multiple addresses shipped out to. I doubt check the check out process, and I haven't had any problems. I love shopping online at Amazon. I have deleted the other apps.

Search results are infuriatingly terrible. Most of the page will invariably be completely unrelated with zero matching words.
